basics.name: Evie Snuggle
basics.label: Site Reliability Engineer
basics.summary: I run a personal blog where I share all of the various projects I'm currently working on. I love experimenting with and testing out new technologies, it's thrilling to see new ideas shape the world in a completely new ways.

volunteer.position: Moderator for the Official Linux Discord Community [>13,271 users]

projects.name: snugg.ie
projects.description: Built a Hugo-based statically generated blog by porting my existing Jekyll-based website into a Hugo-based one. Set up webmentions support, syndication of posts, POSSE, Opengraph and more.

projects.name: Homesweet
projects.description: Built a home-made wooden rack-mount cabinet with servers that runs Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) and a wide range of different Docker containers, as well as a ZFS RAID file-system for hosting a service called Nextcloud, a home personal cloud storage server, similar to Google Drive, but personal and with vastly more storage. This process has been well-documented with two technical blog-posts on my personal website.
keywords: Server Rack and Cloud for the Home

projects.name: Starship & Spacefish
projects.description: Helped design, discuss, contributed code, review code and maintain two large GitHub projects [3.6k stars and 546 stars respectively], which taught me a massive bunch about open-source, working with an entirely remote team, PR code review and automated testing.
keywords: Project Maintainer for Open-Source Rust-based Shell Prompt

projects.name: flossy.me
projects.description: An instant messaging web-application written from scratch using a 'LEMP' full-web-stack, using Linux, Nginx, MySQL and Python (Django) as well as bootstrap HTML/CSS for the front-end. This was made within 14 consecutive hours, recorded and time-lapsed as a personal challenge.
keywords: Open-Source Instant Messaging Web-Application using Python's Django

work.summary: Currently fixing the internet, more coming soon...
Environment: AWS CloudFormation, EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, ECS (Docker), EKS (Kubernetes), ELB, Auto Scaling, Unix / Linux, RHEL6 / AL2
highlights: Using CloudFormation to manage global DNS infrastructure as part of the Route 53 team.
Automated deployment of Java software packages to Linux fleets using Kubernetes and DevOps CI/CD pipelines
Took ownership of the region build development process for a new data‑centre region.
Winner of internal Hackathon with Beacon, a project which automates POSIX permission groups to improve developer experience.

work.summary: Taught 1st and 2nd year students and aid their learning by providing implementations of code, demonstrating them, answering student's questions, teach programming concepts by-example and running through them piece-by-piece in sessions throughout seminars.
Environment: Azure DevOps CI/CD Pipelines, JavaScript C#, .NET Core, Razor, Rozlyn, Git
highlights: Part of the Platform team writing developer tooling & custom Razor-based .NET & JavaScript web frameworks.
Created developer scripts to reduce developer's project building time by 30 minutes.
Writing automated code analysis tools with Rozlyn and C#.
Helped form coding standards to reduce common code review comments by 84%.
Lead the switch in my team from Microsoft TFS to Git by writing new documentation and giving tutorials.
